metadata.title: CVE-2020-11800 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
Zabbix Server 2.2.x and 3.0.x before 3.0.31, and 3.2 allows remoteattackers to execute arbitrary code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11800` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 1:2.4.7+dfsg-2ubuntu2.1+esm2
zabbix-frontend-php - 1:2.4.7+dfsg-2ubuntu2.1+esm2
zabbix-java-gateway - 1:2.4.7+dfsg-2ubuntu2.1+esm2
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 1:2.4.7+dfsg-2ubuntu2.1+esm2
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 1:2.4.7+dfsg-2ubuntu2.1+esm2
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 1:2.4.7+dfsg-2ubuntu2.1+esm2
zabbix-server-mysql - 1:2.4.7+dfsg-2ubuntu2.1+esm2
zabbix-server-pgsql - 1:2.4.7+dfsg-2ubuntu2.1+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: zabbix package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.4.7+dfsg-2ubuntu2.1+esm2').
